Home
Tickets & Events
Memberships
Introducing MCB Memberships! Book on your time. Enjoy discounts, flexibility, and all the drama (onstage).
MCB Memberships offer a new way to experience the ballet — flexible, affordable, and packed with perks. Whether you're a student, professional, or part of a corporate group, there’s a membership designed for you. Pay a one-time seasonal fee, then unlock access to discounted tickets, free exchanges, and more.
Memberships are only available at the Arsht Center for the 2025/26 Season.
Why You'll Love Memberships
So, what do you get with your membership? (Other than bragging rights.) Access to benefits and perks you’ll actually use, including:
Free Ticket Exchanges
– Keep your calendar (and your evening) stress-free.
Early Access to Tickets
– Book your tickets before the public.
Discounted Tickets
– Lock in your reduced member rate, all season long.
No Service Fees
– No surprise costs. Just your member rate, every time.
Member Special Events & Exclusive Extras
– From member mixers to surprise offers there’s always something more to enjoy.
Benefits vary by membership.
Membership Options
Corporate
Treat your team or clients to unforgettable nights at the ballet with premium seats, VIP perks, and community impact.
On Pointe
Designed for ballet lovers who want great seats, great value, and the freedom to book on their own schedule.
Barre Society
A stylish membership for professionals (ages 26-40), that pairs world-class ballet with social events and networking opportunities.
$25 Under 25
Great seats, low prices, zero pressure—the perfect way for anyone under 25 to dive into the magic of ballet.
How to Use Your Membership
Using your membership is easy! Just follow these steps to book your tickets:
Step 1
–
Log in to your MCB Account
Click here
to log in and access your membership benefits.*
* Benefits will not apply if you are not logged in.
Step 2
–
Choose your performance and pick your seats
Browse the season schedule and select the show you’d like to attend. Tickets must be redeemed at least 72 hours before the performance of your choice. Then, select seats within your membership zone. Not sure where your membership is valid?
Click here to check your zone.
Step 3
–
Add to cart and checkout
Once you’ve chosen your seats, add them to your cart. Then choose your preferred delivery method and pay to complete your order.
That’s it! Your member benefits — including your discounted price, free exchanges, and no service fees — will apply automatically.
Membership FAQs
How is a membership different from a subscription?
Premium subscriptions
offer the added benefit of securing the same seats each year when you renew, while getting first access to change your seats before tickets are released to the public.
A membership
allows you to book from the best available seats in your membership zone when it is convenient for you.
How do I verify my age eligibility for my membership?
Some memberships such as the
$25 Under 25
and
Barre Society
require age verification.
Click here
to verify your eligibility in two easy steps.
Fill out the
form
including your email, first and last name, and your company or school. Click Continue.
Upload an image or pdf a valid ID.
Once your file has been successfully uploaded, you may close the window.
You will receive an email confirmation from
audienceservices@miamicityballet.org
once your eligibility has been approved and your membership is active.
Can I use my membership for any performance?
Memberships are valid for all main season performances at the
Arsht Center
. Select memberships include access to our seasonal presentation of
The Nutcracker
, please check your membership benefits to see if your membership is eligible for Nutcracker booking.
Memberships cannot be used for MCB School year-end performances.
When and how do I redeem tickets?
Membership tickets must be redeemed at least
72 hours before the performance
you plan to attend.
Tickets can only be redeemed online through your MCB account.
Click here
to log into your MCB account and select the performance you want to book for. Select seats within your membership zone and then “checkout” to complete your order.
If your zone is sold out, you’ll get access to the next best available section.
Tickets cannot be redeemed at the venue.
Are seats held for members?
Due to high demand for our productions we do not hold seats for member or subscriber redemption once our single tickets go on sale. However, members do receive
early access
for newly added performances.
We recommend booking early for the best options.
Where can I sit with my membership?
Each membership gives you access to a specific seating zone — plus any zones further from the stage (i.e., lower price points). When booking, be sure to select seats within your eligible zones:
Corporate Memberships (Premium & Plus)
Access Front Orchestra and any zones behind it.
On Pointe Membership
Access Rear Orchestra Circle, Tier 2, Tier 3, and Tier 4.
Barre Society Membership (ages 26–40)
Access Tier 2, Tier 3, and Tier 4.
Student Membership (ages 18–25)
Access Tier 3 and Tier 4 only.
You’ll only see your member pricing when selecting seats in these eligible zones.
What if my membership zone is sold out?
You’ll
still have access to the next best available zone or section with open seats.
Can I use my membership at other venues?
Currently, during this inaugural year, memberships are only valid for performances at the
Arsht Center
.
However, we understand that things come up. If you have already booked your ticket for a performance at the Arsht Center you can call or email an audience service representative and request to have your existing tickets exchanged and moved to the same production at either the
Broward Center
or
Kravis Center
. All exchange policies still apply.
Can I purchase more than one membership?
No
, due to the limited number of memberships available, each person may
purchase
one membership per season. If you
purchased
a membership and wish to upgrade your membership to a different level, please contact a member of the
Audience Services
team
for assistance
.
When does my membership expire? Can I renew my membership?
All membership benefits expire on May 1, 2026.
Any unused benefits or tickets are not transferable to the following season productions.
Memberships are a pilot program this season. We’ll contact you in summer 2026 about renewing or upgrading to a subscription.
Have feedback about the membership program?
We’d
love to hear from you! Share what
you’ve
enjoyed — or how we can improve — by emailing us at
audienceservices@miamicityballet.org
Have more questions?
Click here
to visit the full list of Membership FAQs.

Make a gift today
Your generous support is critical to keeping our artistic, educational and community engagement programs growing.
Support
Home
Support Us
Through your support and dedication, Miami City Ballet has transformed the lives of thousands with exceptional dance and dance education. Your generous support is critical to keeping Miami City Ballet's artistic, educational and community engagement programs growing.
THANK YOU
Miami City Ballet extends our heartfelt thanks and appreciation to you, our donors, for your incredible generosity and support.
Over the years, MCB has become a place where dreams do come true. For young children who have a creative spark inside of them that makes them want to dance. For people who aspire to a life on the stage seeking the opportunity to train, grow, and perform. And for dancers from around the world who want to share the stage with some of the absolute best.
It is for you – and because of you – that we can continue to present dance of the highest caliber. Your generosity facilitates over 50 performances annually, allowing countless individuals and families the opportunity to experience world-class dance throughout South Florida, across the nation, and around the globe.
That’s not all! Your kind support also helps us to touch and transform lives through the power of dance, within both our school and Community Engagement programs. We continue to bring diversity and inclusivity into all aspects of what we do, removing barriers, and providing equity for all.
Together we are making a difference - on and off the stage - and for that, we are ever grateful. Thank you for being an invaluable part of our success!

THE FINE ART OF COLLABORATION
Corporate Partners
Corporate Council
Corporate Partners
Miami City Ballet is one of South Florida’s most influential and innovative performing arts brands, with a soaring international presence and expansive education and community outreach programming.
We thrive on creating unique, mutually beneficial, and custom-tailored partnerships that deliver significant and measurable benefits for our partners through brand awareness, audience engagement, media exposure, employee benefits, and unforgettable networking and client entertainment packages.
I hope that you will reach out and learn more about how we can cultivate meaningful and lasting partnerships that will enrich our vibrant community.
Corporate Leader

TECO
Partner with MCB for…
BRAND AWARENESS
Achieving increased visibility, awareness or brand perception through sponsor recognition and alignment with one of the most significant cultural brands in Miami.
AUDIENCE ENGAGEMENT
Targeting multicultural, highly educated and discerning audiences, including opinion-formers and influencers, corporate leaders, and high net worth individuals.
MEDIA EXPOSURE
Recognition and branding opportunities to include press and advertising campaigns with national and regional activity and innovative promotional approaches.
GLOBAL PRESENCE
Opportunity to associate your company with key international markets at the highest standards in partnership with Miami City Ballet, both locally and on the international stage.
ENTERTAINMENT & HOSPITALITY
Unique client networking, entertainment opportunities and event management services. Invite your clients to exclusive functions with our artistic staff, dancers, and loyal patrons. Access our private patron lounges for refreshments, take your clients on private backstage tours, come watch rehearsal at our state of the art facility in Miami Beach and consider planning an event at our beautiful studios.
CONCIERGE SERVICE & TICKET BANK
Offering your guests, clients, and employees unforgettable experiences with a highly personalized VIP concierge service for all ticketing needs including complimentary and discounted tickets and VIP valet parking privileges.
COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT
Engaging with the community through outstanding cultural and educational programming to convey ethical corporate values and a corporate social responsibility agenda.
BUILD A LASTING PARTNERSHIP WITH MCB

Support Us
Your Support Matters
Government & Foundation Partners
Miami City Ballet is grateful for the support of our foundation and government partners, whose generous funding fortifies the breadth of our mission to produce and present the highest level of dance performances throughout Florida and the United States. Grant funding allows us to advance artistic excellence in classical ballet, deepen our commitment to holistic dance education, and eliminate barriers to the arts for thousands of community members at every level of arts exploration.
Major funding for Miami City Ballet provided by the John S. and James L. Knight Foundation, the Arison Arts Foundation, and The Ansin Foundation.
Government funding is provided by:Miami-Dade County Department of Cultural Affairs and the Cultural Affairs Council, the Miami-Dade County Mayor and Board of County Commissioners, with support from the City of Miami Beach Department of Tourism and Culture, Cultural Arts Council, and the Miami Beach Mayor and City Commissioners. Sponsored in part by the State of Florida through the Division of Arts and Culture and the National Endowment for the Arts; Broward County Board of County Commissioners of Broward County, Florida, as recommended by the Broward Cultural Council; and The Children’s Trust, a dedicated source of revenue established by voter referendum to improve the lives of children and families in Miami-Dade County by making strategic investments in their future.

Community Engagement
Ballet For Young People
Ballet for Young People is a commitment to eliminating barriers and providing access to live arts performances.
Performed by the Miami City Ballet School Pre-Professional dancers and Miami City Ballet Company dancers, Ballet for Young People is a series of interactive performances that are fun and engaging. With a dynamic live narration, the audience is captivated with dance and experience fully costumed excerpts from the Ballet’s most enchanting and renowned repertory like:
A Midsummer Night’s Dream
and the beloved holiday classic
George Balanchine’s The Nutcracker®
— all inspired by great works of literature.
Every December, students are invited to a student matinee of Miami City Ballet’s
George Balanchine’s The Nutcracker®
through the MDCPS (Miami-Dade County Public Schools) Cultural Passport Program. Audiences receive educational guides with activities related to the history of ballet, the ballets performed, and the exciting world of dance. Ballet for Young People is MCB’s community commitment to eliminate barriers and provide access for all to the arts.
CONTACT US
For more information on Ballet for Young People performances, contact
outreach@miamicityballet.org
.

Tickets & Events
Memberships
Introducing MCB Memberships! Book on your time. Enjoy discounts, flexibility, and all the drama (onstage).
MCB Memberships offer a new way to experience the ballet — flexible, affordable, and packed with perks. Whether you're a student, professional, or part of a corporate group, there’s a membership designed for you. Pay a one-time seasonal fee, then unlock access to discounted tickets, free exchanges, and more.
Memberships are only available at the Arsht Center for the 2025/26 Season.
Why You'll Love Memberships
So, what do you get with your membership? (Other than bragging rights.) Access to benefits and perks you’ll actually use, including:
Free Ticket Exchanges
– Keep your calendar (and your evening) stress-free.
Early Access to Tickets
– Book your tickets before the public.
Discounted Tickets
– Lock in your reduced member rate, all season long.
No Service Fees
– No surprise costs. Just your member rate, every time.
Member Special Events & Exclusive Extras
– From member mixers to surprise offers there’s always something more to enjoy.
Benefits vary by membership.
Membership Options
Corporate
Treat your team or clients to unforgettable nights at the ballet with premium seats, VIP perks, and community impact.
On Pointe
Designed for ballet lovers who want great seats, great value, and the freedom to book on their own schedule.
Barre Society
A stylish membership for professionals (ages 26-40), that pairs world-class ballet with social events and networking opportunities.
$25 Under 25
Great seats, low prices, zero pressure—the perfect way for anyone under 25 to dive into the magic of ballet.
How to Use Your Membership
Using your membership is easy! Just follow these steps to book your tickets:
Step 1
–
Log in to your MCB Account
Click here
to log in and access your membership benefits.*
* Benefits will not apply if you are not logged in.
Step 2
–
Choose your performance and pick your seats
Browse the season schedule and select the show you’d like to attend. Tickets must be redeemed at least 72 hours before the performance of your choice. Then, select seats within your membership zone. Not sure where your membership is valid?
Click here to check your zone.
Step 3
–
Add to cart and checkout
Once you’ve chosen your seats, add them to your cart. Then choose your preferred delivery method and pay to complete your order.
That’s it! Your member benefits — including your discounted price, free exchanges, and no service fees — will apply automatically.
Membership FAQs
How is a membership different from a subscription?
Premium subscriptions
offer the added benefit of securing the same seats each year when you renew, while getting first access to change your seats before tickets are released to the public.
A membership
allows you to book from the best available seats in your membership zone when it is convenient for you.
How do I verify my age eligibility for my membership?
Some memberships such as the
$25 Under 25
and
Barre Society
require age verification.
Click here
to verify your eligibility in two easy steps.
Fill out the
form
including your email, first and last name, and your company or school. Click Continue.
Upload an image or pdf a valid ID.
Once your file has been successfully uploaded, you may close the window.
You will receive an email confirmation from
audienceservices@miamicityballet.org
once your eligibility has been approved and your membership is active.
Can I use my membership for any performance?
Memberships are valid for all main season performances at the
Arsht Center
. Select memberships include access to our seasonal presentation of
The Nutcracker
, please check your membership benefits to see if your membership is eligible for Nutcracker booking.
Memberships cannot be used for MCB School year-end performances.
When and how do I redeem tickets?
Membership tickets must be redeemed at least
72 hours before the performance
you plan to attend.
Tickets can only be redeemed online through your MCB account.
Click here
to log into your MCB account and select the performance you want to book for. Select seats within your membership zone and then “checkout” to complete your order.
If your zone is sold out, you’ll get access to the next best available section.
Tickets cannot be redeemed at the venue.
Are seats held for members?
Due to high demand for our productions we do not hold seats for member or subscriber redemption once our single tickets go on sale. However, members do receive
early access
for newly added performances.
We recommend booking early for the best options.
Where can I sit with my membership?
Each membership gives you access to a specific seating zone — plus any zones further from the stage (i.e., lower price points). When booking, be sure to select seats within your eligible zones:
Corporate Memberships (Premium & Plus)
Access Front Orchestra and any zones behind it.
On Pointe Membership
Access Rear Orchestra Circle, Tier 2, Tier 3, and Tier 4.
Barre Society Membership (ages 26–40)
Access Tier 2, Tier 3, and Tier 4.
Student Membership (ages 18–25)
Access Tier 3 and Tier 4 only.
You’ll only see your member pricing when selecting seats in these eligible zones.
What if my membership zone is sold out?
You’ll
still have access to the next best available zone or section with open seats.
Can I use my membership at other venues?
Currently, during this inaugural year, memberships are only valid for performances at the
Arsht Center
.
However, we understand that things come up. If you have already booked your ticket for a performance at the Arsht Center you can call or email an audience service representative and request to have your existing tickets exchanged and moved to the same production at either the
Broward Center
or
Kravis Center
. All exchange policies still apply.
Can I purchase more than one membership?
No
, due to the limited number of memberships available, each person may
purchase
one membership per season. If you
purchased
a membership and wish to upgrade your membership to a different level, please contact a member of the
Audience Services
team
for assistance
.
When does my membership expire? Can I renew my membership?
All membership benefits expire on May 1, 2026.
Any unused benefits or tickets are not transferable to the following season productions.
Memberships are a pilot program this season. We’ll contact you in summer 2026 about renewing or upgrading to a subscription.
Have feedback about the membership program?
We’d
love to hear from you! Share what
you’ve
enjoyed — or how we can improve — by emailing us at
audienceservices@miamicityballet.org
Have more questions?
Click here
to visit the full list of Membership FAQs.
